alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Beaches; Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:24AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorm will impact southern Los Angeles County through 515 AM PDT... At 419 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms from Lakewood to Compton to Long Beach, moving west northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Long Beach... Inglewood... Torrance... Downtown Los Angeles... Redondo Beach... Carson... El Segundo... Westchester... and Lynwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Beaches; Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley; Malibu Coast
